intro: Sedum atsaense, commonly known as the Atsaense stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid and rocky environments in Central Asia. It features fleshy, paddle-shaped leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in dry conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It is often found growing on rock surfaces or in well-drained soils. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
